Reviews.Title: “Going home again was a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: OursIsTheFury84
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in Memphis and we decided to stay close to Beale Street to visit with some friends in the area and take care of some personal things. We booked on very very short notice and this place, while rated 3 stars, was extremely affordable and the location was acceptable for what we needed. It ended up being the worst hotel stay we've ever had as a couple. The place was disgusting. Moldy, damp, musty, and bleak. It looked like one of those old creepy hotel rooms you only see in movies. Well, they do exist. There's no room service, housekeeping, no food on site(not even vending machines). It apparently used alot for teens to have underage drinking parties because the management just doesn't give two cents. We asked to stay after we found ourselves underneath one such party. We were told that the party "would be over soon" and they couldn't do anything? Really? There were so many terrible other things that I could go on, but no need to pile on at this point.

Reviews.Title: “a stay in the city landfill”
Reviews.Author: botkin7
Reviews.Content: dark ,ditry & smells like the landfill. who would of thought from the photos on the web!! no restuarant open or pool.no vending machines (soda,coffee,snacks) so much to list this could go on all day...good luck if you stay your going to need it.....

Reviews.Title: “nasty hotel”
Reviews.Author: feefeo
Reviews.Content: We was here for 10 days and hated our stay the rooms are dirty and the smell the blankets are bugg ridden the towels are not enought the standerd of cleaning very very poor the location is more then 3 miles to beale strreet some of the reception staff have no people skills when you ask the question ref the area the dont no we asked if they had un umbrella as the skys opened up no nothing helpfull at all the only good thing anout this hotel was jack the guy at reception hes very helpfull i wldnt stay here for free

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Tracey123456
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump....nothing like the pictures they advertise...the room was old and musty, the carpet was threadbare, and the washroom was old and dated and not very clean. I would not stay there again. Our window faced the roof and ventilation system...I am glad we only stayed there one night. Better to stay with a well known hotel, than this old relic.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice and comfy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: verypleasedguest
Reviews.Content: I must be honest not the newest hotel. But he hotel was very clean and decent. free coffee in the lobby, high speed internet. and absolutely the best pool in town. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Give them a chance.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULD NOT ADVISE ANYONE TO STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: STLCHINADOLL
Reviews.Content: It is an old hotel with no updates.The carpet was filthy and needs to be replaced.You had to hold down the handle on the toilet for it to flush properly.Water and dirt would back up in the bathtub hours after you take a shower,then slowly drain ,leaving all the dirt in the tub.There was no type of ventilation in the bathroom.They have older model TV's that has a fuzzy picture.The restaurant was closed due to remodeling.The pool was closed for whatever reason.And you have to pay $6.50 a day for parking.IT IS DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!! I will never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Never read any review, but it is JUST a hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehump1
Reviews.Content: We went to the Memphis in May on 05/15/2009. We had planned on a stay outside Memphis. We arrived in Memphis around 11:30pm and saw the seedier side, the hotels where the prison fences line the parking lots and KNEW we needed to be in a better spot. We tried the Marriott and Holiday Inn Express, which of course were full. The Red Roof Inn in Homewood Alabama has taught us to STAY AWAY from them, so when we found the Artisan, we were okay with it. We drove into the dungeon to park. It was dark and dusty, but my kid loved it when the door closing made such an echo for about 20 seconds. The hotel was HOT. The room was an inferno. The smell in the rooms was distinctive, just not sure what it was. We got there around midnight, and unplugged the telly to charge phones, ipods, etc. so we never needed it. The phone on the desk was old fashioned, but who needs one of those? We had plenty of towels, took three consecutive showers with plenty of hot water. We checked out at 10am with free coffee from friendly staff. Never saw homeless people, the room wasn't the best, but okay. It reminds you of a 1970's Elvis era hotel. Do you go to Memphis to stay in a room. If so, you may not like this one. If you need a place to crash, this one works like any other budget hotel. And the rooms on the website? Where the hell did they take those photos??? Not at the Artisan Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!! Disgusting! Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Sunt0t
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. There was mold and dirt EVERYWHERE. The roof was patched up because of leaks. It was half popcorn and half leak patches. The tv was like 20 years old and channels were extremely grainy and the color for all the channels was purple. Most of the walls were painted black, as to hide blemishes. They were also VERY poorly painted. The doors were spray painted black in some parts to hide blemishes. Also the bathroom tiles were spray painted in white. All furniture was VERY beat up. Bathroom sink leaked on the bottom. It was snowing when we stayed there and the heater wasn't working. The carpet was filthy and had nail clippings that hadn't been vacuumed On top of this, the parking was spooky. It was underground. It reminded me of some sort of horror movie were you are in a filthy, gloomy underground parking were most of the lights are broken or blinking. It had no sort of night security whatsoever, AND anyone could come in. I was very concerned I wouldn't find my car the next morning, especially since Memphis has some of the highest crime ratings in the country. Right by the elevator was a sign that said that they were not responsible if your car got stolen. VERY COMFORTING! On top of all this, they charge you $6.50 for parking. This is on top of your rate, and they won't tell you about this until you leave. Very sneaky and almost fraudulent, since the booking was already prepaid. The elevators were nasty. Made horrible noises and stunk like cigarettes. The staff was nice, but dressed unprofessional. I was greeted by a guy that had a bandana on. AND to make our stay spookier, this a ten story building, but they were only like 5 other people staying the night. We were on the 8th floor.... sooo everything was very quiet, but not in a good way. ONLY good thing: the bed, it was pretty comfortable. DON"T trust any pictures you see, this place is a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: esnell
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the worst places I've stayed in all my life. It is dark and Gothic looking. Upon arrival I went to my room and there were stains on the wall and the floor as well as in the tub, I took pictures of this and went to the front desk and told them I was not going to be staying there because it was filthy she offered my another room and this one was still dirty and dingy. I reluctantly accepted because I was pressed for time. The parking area is dark and dirty. I usually try to find the best in things but in this case I can't.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Fine-- Cheap and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bajohns
Reviews.Content: Not sure why all the bad reviews, place is decent in a great location close to a bunch of great bars (hi tone, hueys, lamplighter ) in a pretty safe neighbourhood. rooms are decent, there is a pool and i its way better than the other cheap accoms in town.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_ILMom_of_3
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Orbitz so it was prepaid. I chose this one because it is close to the FedEx Forum and other attractions, a good price for a hotel in the midtown area. The first time we stayed there on Nov 22-24, it wasn't what I expected but ok. The description I read from Orbitz says, it has a restaurant and room service (none of these). I don't even know if they have internet access since I did not attempt to use it. On Nov. 27 through 29, we went back (stop over from Dallas to Chicago). This time was a total disappointment, a nightmare if you're asking me. We got in the room, the phone was not working, I had to use my cell phone to call the front desk. Reported it to the front clerk but did not do anything. We did not get any drinking glasses or ice bucket either, the sink in the bathroom did not have cold water. The next morning, as we were leaving to go to the Memphis Zoo, we realized that the door does not lock automatically behind us. We waited for the maintenance guy for over an hour, the kids were starving and finally he came, we had to leave him in our room. The hotel did not even offer to move us to another room. When we got back we thought everything was fixed,... it wasn't! The door did not lock again, I was fixing my hair in the bathroom while the kids were asleep, the door opened. It was a stranger who claimed he thought that was his room, he apologized... I complained to the front desk when I checked out and the clerk was even rude as if I did them wrong by complaining while there were other guests in the lobby. I asked for the manager's name and contact info so I can write a letter, she hesitantly gave it to me. If you can afford to stay somewhere else definitely avoid this hotel. BTW, they also charge $6.50 per night for parking which was not mentioned in the Orbitz website.

Reviews.Title: “Not soo bad!”
Reviews.Author: waikikigirl
Reviews.Content: I cannot give a bad review, like so many others here, of the Artisan Hotel. We liked it, it was really okay for us and for the price. We stayed there 4 nights in a row and then another night before our flight to Hawaii. The location is good, of course it is not in the middle of Memphis, but we took the bus to Beale Street (there is a bus station across) and a taxi for the way back. It is not a long way to Beale Street. And of course it is much cheaper than the Downtown hotels. We were on the top floor. We didnÂ´t hear any noise at all. The room was clean and comfortable with a big window. The view was very good. The room had 2 King Size bed, a table with chairs, TV and enough space for our many luggage. The bathroom was clean and had everything you need. The staff at the front desk was nice and friendly, maybe not like in a top notch hotel, but we found them okay. One evening I had a nice chat with the front desk girl. The elevator is a little bit old and shabby, they have two elevators, but only one worked. There is no restaurant or bar in this hotel, but I liked the lobby, it is very old-fashioned and dark but in a good way. On our arrival, we asked for a safe deposit box, but the man at the front desk told us, that the safe deposit boxes were broken. This sounded a little bit strange for me. So he suggested to use the hotel safe, what we did. He said, that only the manager has a key for the safe and the manager would be there from 9.00 am to 4.00 pm daily. On our check out day the manager was not in sight, although it was 10.00 am on a weekday. So nobody could open up the safe. We were a little bit angry about that because we needed our passports and other personal things. But the lady behind the desk called the manager and within 30 min. she was there. A little bit disappointed was the fact, that she didnÂ´t tell us, that she is sorry about the trouble and our wait. She said nothing, didnÂ´t even look at us. Maybe she was embarrassed. The parking garage is, as some said before, a bit dark and there is no gate, but that didnÂ´t bother us much. All in all I am not sure if I could recommend this hotel. I have mixed feelings about the Artisan, but I think I would stay there again, because of the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ivan the Terrible”
Reviews.Author: cookienini
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel in the world. I have stayed at hotels in Sri Lanka that are better than this place. The hotel staff makes Ivan the Terrible look like a nice guy.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: jaydarl
Reviews.Content: To say the least the Artisan was a disappointment. First of all, only one of two elevators was in working order making for some long waits. The rooms are spartan but decent sized, could use some updating but I would say that they are passable if you are not too picky. The location is great from a Memphis perspective, walking distance to a drug store and restaurants but not to any tourist attraction. The biggest turn off, similar to another reviewer here, was theft with no appearance of forcible entry from a member of our party, stolen was a laptop, Ipod, professional digital camera, Nintendo DS, and a few other things. Again, with absolutely no sign of forced entry. I hate to cast aspersions on anyone but travelers should be aware of such things when choosing a hotel. This hotel has potential and years back I remember it being relatively nice when it was under another moniker. However, for now, I can only recommend this hotel for budget-minded travelers with low expectations, i.e. the backpack set, who intend on keeping their valuables on their person and not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Dump”
Reviews.Author: Serentiy
Reviews.Content: This was far by the most terrible hotel I have stayed at. I work in the hospitality industry and never had I stayed in such a dump. The rooms were something out of the 70's. The pictures on the web were nothing like they were advertised. The carpet was dirty, the beds were hard. We even on serveral ocassions had to take the service elevator (the elevator the workers take) to get to the lobby because the main one took an average of 15 minutes to come up. On several ocassions we had to take 7 flights of stairs up and down just to get to our room. The housekeeping was half done and we only had a few towels in our room. We stayed here becuase of the location, but this is a lesson learned, from now on if I have to drive 40 miles to stay at a decent hotel, I will. I am honestly telling you the truth, a Motel Six is a luxury compared to this nightmare. I was so embarrassed after this and felt tricked and lied to. I would not recommend this hotel to a homeless person, this is how bad the situation is at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stole two laptops”
Reviews.Author: graceland5700
Reviews.Content: Our family went to Memphis and were thinking that though the Artisan was not the nicest place we'd stayed at, it was ok until...we got back from seeing the sights and both my daughter's school laptop and my husband's laptop from work were stolen from our room. We went to ask the front desk, who were incredibly uncooperative. Over 3000 dollars in property was stolen from our room, and they didn't even apologize, there was no evidence of forced entry either, which meant it had to be someone with a key. We had to go to the police, and still haven't heard from the owner or the manager of the hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keyona
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely terrible to say the least...The pictures that are online are probably of what the hotel looked like when they first opened. The only thing that looks relatively the same is the pool and the looby. The rooms were an insult to anyone paying there money to stay there. They look nothing like the photo on their site. Nasty sheets, holes in walls, nasty shower, toilet and sink. The worst towels ever!! The homeless people sitting in the lobby were a bit of a scare also. The restaraunt that they have photos of looks as if has been closed down for years. This was a complete scam and I hope that they are shut down for false advertising. They say that they hold $50 on your card in case of incidentals well they charged me charged my card $50 and I still have not been reinbursed. They also charge $6.50 for parking in the most unsafe parking deck ever. There is no gate or security provided as they say. The staff is another story they were very unprofessional.I could go on and on but even if you are just looking to lay your head somewhere for a few hours, there are far berrter Motel 6 places that are better than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: rshu330
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised all the poor reviews of this hotel. I booked this hotel because reviews on Hotels.com and Expedia.com were decent. However, the day before I flew out to Memphis, I discovered all the negative reviews on TripAdvisor. I was scared and even considered cancelling my reservation. I'm glad I did not because I really feel that the Artisan is a hidden gem. I don't really know what all the fuss is about. The hotel is a 2/3 star hotel. It's a very decent place to stay and the rooms are clean and spacious. The hotel is also in a very good location and very reasonably priced. There's a 24hr Walgreens and Starbucks across the street. The bus to downtown is just around the corner. The neighborhood felt safe to me, and I was never bothered or harassed by anyone. There is ample parking in a 3 level underground garage. I had no problems entering and exiting the garage as previous reviews have mentioned. The elevators are surprisingly fast, and I never had to wait long for one. The staff was plesant and friendly. The only complaint I have is that my toilet was running, and I asked for maitenance twice, but the problem was never fixed. I stayed in my 2 bed room for a total of 5 nights. I feel like I was there long enough to get a good impression of the place. I do not work for the hotel or am in no way connected to it. I just feel like this hotel deserves better ratings than it's getting. I really recommend you give this place a try and find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: istanbulSavannah
Reviews.Content: Stayed 05/16 05/17. booked for king size bed. Found 2 doubles. rebooked rooms. Left a bag in the 1st room. was given a key the next day, told the room was vacant still, given a key to get the bag only to barg in on someone sleeping. The attendant said his records showed no one there. Very odd! Saturday night a room obove us was playing loud music. We called 11:40 pm to complain. Was told they would send someone to have music turned down, 10 minutes later the music was even louder. Called again after 12:00. Brandy answered and promised to send someone up. 10 minutes later they turned the music up even louder.We finally got to sleep after 2:00 am when the party ended. We flew out the next morning with 3 hours of sleep, lay over in airports, and worn out and disgusted. I emailed the Artisan 2 days ago, asked to speak with the owner. No response. TheT.V did not work. It was not just inconsiderate but down right ignorant for people to play music that loud in a public accomadation. It was criminal for the Hotel to lie to us and allow this to happen! Stay at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “UNACCEPTABLE”
Reviews.Author: Jac84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on May 2, 2008 - May 4, 2008. I am very displeased with my very unpleasant experience especially with the unacceptable service that I received for the price that I paid ($295) to stay at this hotel. My room was also extremely unclean. There were no towels, hand towels or wash clothes in the room when we arrived at around 2 pm. My husband and I only recieved two towels during our entire stay despite my repeated requests. Between the two of us we ask for towels at least two dozen times within the two day stay. We only received them because we snatched them off of a maids cart. They were the only ones she had. During the rest of the stay we never encountered another housekeeper and our room was never serviced. We had to use a hairdryer to dry off after our showers. I asked to speak with a manager many times and was never able to speak with one. I am much less than satisfied and will never return to this hotel. I will also suggest that no one else stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is interesting”
Reviews.Author: terri1234
Reviews.Content: And it stops there. Rooms were in need of renovation, though mine was clean. I booked a king and at first they put me in a double. Went back to the desk and they switched me to a king. A little heads up here. I booked a king on priceline and paid a little more just to get a king. The person at the desk said they DO NOT guarantee room type. Our room had no towels, we had to call 2 times to get them about 8 hours later. I think that they were under staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Artisan is missing Artistry”
Reviews.Author: NiniAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: First, the positive: The lobby was as pictured on the website. The hotel room had a comfortable bed, TV, mini-fridge and hairdryer. And by all appearances was relatively clean. Starbucks and Walgreens were on the corner. That sums up the best part about our stay at the Artisan. Upon arrival we had to call out for someone to come to the desk to check us in. This was typical anytime we went to the desk (which was frequently as the card keys for the room seemed to have a one unlock limit - so every other time we needed to enter our room it was a trip to the front desk to have the keys re-coded). The room was a disappointment, to say the least. We were obviously sent to an unrenovated room. It was, and I put this kindly, tired. The lamps and furniture looked like garage sale finds. The furniture was worn and needed a good cleaning. There was no alarm clock or coffee maker in the room (something we have come to consider standard in any hotel room). The bathroom had the usual lotion and shampoo/conditioner "samples" though the "seal" was broken on the shampoo bottle....that takes recycling a little too far. We were allotted two worn bath towels and two washcloths - no hand towels (this was for two adults - don't know about you, but I like having extra towels and hand towels!) The Artisan has a long way to go to live up to it's name.

Reviews.Title: “Old Dirty Dump”
Reviews.Author: simonsez33
Reviews.Content: A family member booked two adjoining rooms for a family event - upon arrival we were immediately disappointed. The restaurant and lounge were no longer open, we were advised to park in the parking garage and were told their was 24-hour security. Upon entry into the garage - it looked like something out of Sleepy Hollow - dark, dank and plain scary. We opted to park on the top parking lot even though we were told not to. The lobby is extremely dark and outdated. My issue was with the rooms - the door to the adjoining room was broken and in splinters, there were cockroaches on the walls, filthy carpet on the floor, dirty walls, hard beds, no remote for T.V. and NO COFFEE POT. It's not that close to Downtown Memphis as it's advertised - it's a good 5 miles with nothing around it but Starbucks and a Walgreens. When we were leaving we discovered that the staff lets HOMELESS people sleep on the couches in the lobby - boy that really made me feel safe. Don't stay here - it's not worth $5 much less $69 - it would be more comfortable and cleaner to sleep in your own car!

Reviews.Title: “Run Away From This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: TulsaGal
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel unless you want a bad experience. The photos on the internet make this hotel look fine. However, at check-in there was an unattended ladder blocking part of the front doors, and we had to wait for the computers to "change shifts" to check in (at least that is what the rude general manager on duty said). The wheels on the luggage carts were about to fall off, and the carts themselves were in very poor shape. The under-hotel parking is not up to par, and is downright scary. There is a $6 daily charge for the "privilege" of parking in this sorry excuse for a garage. The ceiling in our room had quite obviously had a major water leak that had never been properly repaired. The central window could be opened, but the lock on the inside was inoperable, and there was a ledge below the windows. This, along with the fact the top lock on the room door had been taken off, certainly posed safety issues. There was no microwave and, more importantly, no coffee pot. When we asked another front desk employee about the coffe pot, we were told the hotel was owned by a Las Vegas hotel by the same name, where they almost never have coffee pots. We had one cup to go with the ice bucket, and had to go downstairs for another cup. There was no working ice machine on the at least two of the eight floors (we chose not to visit every floor in search of ice). The hallways smelled bad, the restaurant/lounge was not operating, and when we asked for a late checkout, a third employee said late checkout was noon (a mere 1 hour later than regular checkout time). This hotel needs a LARGE infusion of cash to COMPLETELY renovate it, and needs to have a NEW manager. Until that time, it should be closed down for even attempting to pass itself off as a hotel. The place is a DUMP!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Sucks”
Reviews.Author: Altravelingirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 3 star hotel and really it is a half a star with a face lift. The hallways and rooms smelled of mildew, we had only 2 towels and no washcloths, my phone didn't work, didn't even have a remote for the TV. I was looking forward to staying at this hotel but I promise you I will never stay at another Artisan. When I checked out they decided to tell me that I will also be charged for a $6.50 parking fee and the parking garage is very old and doesn't even have a guard. All in all THIS HOTEL SUCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Value”
Reviews.Author: Shawnster172
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not fantastic, I could probably complain about a few things on here, but I'll focus on the positive. For anyone planning on entertaining themselves in downtown Memphis, this hotel is only minutes away on Union Ave, which is a main artery into downtown. Very convienient. I booked through Kayak.com, and got a great price. I don't think I could have found a similar hotel for anywhere near the price in the area. The decor in the lobby was very interesting. Not the best in Memphis, but one of the better values.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: johnucfsae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Liberty Bowl game. It was relatively inexpensive, comparable to HI Express. The location was great, a short distance to downtown and close to the Liberty Bowl. I would stay there on a guys weekend, but would not take the family. The lobby and the staff were excellent, but the rooms did need updating and the carpet was in bad shape.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JayGUKE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artisan for the first time. We live on the other side of the county, had to attend a downtown wedding , and didn't want to drive back home. The Marriott, etc. were booked for the Liberty Bowl. We were very hesitant about this stay after reading reviews on this website. However, we were pleasantly surprised and will stay there again. Our room was very clean, the bed was fine, and the water in the shower was still hot after two showers in a row. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. As for the view, it IS downtown Memphis, so you can't expect a beach view!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: tsarosdy
Reviews.Content: What a piece of cr*p hotel. I'm sure it was very nice in the 1940s, but it has not been taken care of since. Minimal towels, old or broken funishings, hot water was out or weak most of my two day stay. The staff was clearly minimum wage, and didn't care whether you were there or not. There is no room service, the cleaning staff was very weak. There was no coffee pot in the room, which is now standard at all hotels. I travel all over the country 20 - 30 times per year. I generally stay at Marriotts, which are consistently great. This is the worst bang for the buck I have ever had. Only two good things about it: 1) free wireless internet, which worked well, but was unsecured; and 2) there is a Starbucks across the street.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: UtahPuglover
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews several weeks before arrival but was unable to get another hotel that had a shuttle to the conference we were attending. We checked out after 1 night. The manager was very kind and understanding about us checking out 2 days early. There was mold in the bathroom and the room smelled awful. I woke in the morning with major congestion. I have never had a sinus infection in my life before and this came on after sleeping 1 night in the room. We spoke with other guests and they did not get any towels. They were told "the towels are being washed". We were lucky enough to get 2 very small bath towels for 3 people and 1 wash cloth. They put all their money into the art work in the lobby and nothing into the rooms. Take my advice. DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ForKindness
Reviews.Content: Terrible customer service. Management was never available to receive complaints and employees will just direct you to management. Terrible value, I will never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thank god for the artisan!”
Reviews.Author: leatheretteheart
Reviews.Content: i was staying at the red roof which was disgusting. (i have reviewed it as well) and didn't book at the artisan, because people reviewed it negatively on this site. but after my first night at the red roof, a friend staying at the artisan told me he liked it there and to come by and see his room (get you mind out of the gutter!) so i could see if i wanted to move hotels. is every room like the pictures on their website, no. is the room clean, good sized, and like any other hotel room, yes. is the staff really nice and go out of their way to help a tourist, yes. i loved the hotel and will stay there when i come back next year. p.s. the pool is rad!

Reviews.Title: “Plain ole nasty dump that should be torn down.”
Reviews.Author: uf1
Reviews.Content: my Wife and I were in town to atend the Florida and Ole Miss game that was played in Oxford, MS. We arrived on 9-21-07 at approx 11:30 pm. The wait staff was very rude and unfriendly and did not offer any information unless he was asked and then it was an half answer. We went to our room ater going through the mildew smelly halls and when we got there we found a total pig stie. The lights did not work ( Except for one lamp in the corner), the carpet had holes in it and was not vacumed (dust everywhere) the toliet did not flush, there was no hot water, the matress was smaller then the bed frame and was laying sideways, the bed sheets were nasty. We had to spread out our clothes to sleep on. If we wasnt so tired we would have left then. The next morning we checked out and I told the manager of our concerns and she just blew us off. I will never ever go to that place again . We ended up going to the Hampton INN. " What a difference" I hope that the Hotel takes this info as an incentive to do something about it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “DISCRACEFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwirocker
Reviews.Content: We were with a large tour group. The rooms were filthy - I mean really filthy!! Just walking on the carpet in bare feet made the soles of our feet black, adn you could feel the stickiness!! Some of the showers were running cold, the toilet in our room didn't work properly and only half the rooms has working air conditioning - many of them were only blowing out hot air. This was during a week when there were 15 heat-related deaths in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Kaaza
Reviews.Content: Traveler from New Zealand for Elvis Week 10 August 2007 I took a group of 75 New Zealanders to Memphis for Elvis week. This was to be a trip of a life time. We arrived at this hotel and were immediately disappointed. The Hotel is rundown and in need of major repairs. Lift didn't work, Rooms didn't have air conditioning and the ones that did didn't work properly. Rooms where unclean, bathrooms had broken toilets and baths. I would never suggest this hotel to anyone and was embarrassed to have taken my group here.

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke!”
Reviews.Author: cmils
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have stayed at in a long time. When we entered our room, I couldn't believe the nastiness of the area. The bed was a nightmare. It had a thin sheet covering nasty mattresses, and it had the nerve to have a thin mini mattress pad that didn't cover the entire bed. The box springs were nasty and stained and all I kept thinking about was bed bugs and what if that thin sheet move I would be on bare mattresses. The bathroom was not cleaned. It had a broken little nasty green chair that had a pull out stomp. All I could do was stand in the middle of the room in shock. By the time we arrived in Memphis, it was 1:00 AM. We were extremely tired, but I knew that we had to get some lysol at Walgreens across the street before I could lay my head down on that bed. The pillows were flat. The covers looked nasty and it too had a hole in the cover. Luckily for us, as we were going down stairs to get the lysol, someone at the front desk had been attacked and it was a crime scene. So, we immediately went to the front desk and got our money back, We left and went to Holiday Inn on I-40West and for the same amount of money had a good night sleep in a clean hotel with nice pillows and towels. Did I mention the carpeting on the floor was nasty, too? The reason we came to this hotel was due to a family reunion. What a dump to host a reunion. Stay away from this place. Board of Health should close it down.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: jetty1970
Reviews.Content: what a dump would not even have let my dog sleep in the filth that we had to. could not get moved as was elvis week and all hotels booked. changed rooms 3 times and in the end had to clean the room myself before opening cases. have no mangerment in hotel as they got the sack so staff have no idea what is going on there. when spoke to a maid there they did not even have a hoover to clean with?? no towels in room, no tea coffee machine in room, just pure filth though and though. the skirting boards have not be touched for months the carpets are thread bare and filthy dirty. my list could go on and on but take my advice and stay well away from this hotel if you value you health... as this hotel should have a health warning on it to go with the cockroaches on the 8th floor...

Reviews.Title: “They were great to us”
Reviews.Author: jwadegcc
Reviews.Content: The staff--with only one exception--was very helpful while we were on vacation in Memphis. They assisted us in getting cabs, directions, and advice on what to do. We understood that the hotel management is working to improve the entire facility. We did switch rooms our second night, and it was much better than the first. But it was nice of them to let us switch. The price was the best in the city the nights we stayed. One day, I'll be back--and I will go to the Artisan--hopefully when it has more progressed.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! ”
Reviews.Author: Bing2
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again if it were the last place I could stay. We had no toilet paper and the entire hotel was out of toilet paper, we were given boxes of tissue. The person I spoke to for room service was very rude. There was dried vomit on the side of the box springs, there were roach motels behind the tables, the outlets were broken, the floor and sheets were dirty. This hotel was awful! I'm not sure how they passed health inspections. i wouldn't not recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: faith_stl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Memphis in May (Beale Music Festival) because it was the only hotel available and it was reasonably priced. The positives: the lobby is nice and filled with interesting art, the price, covered parking. The pool looked decent - although we didn't use it. The negatives: the rooms could use renovating. Our air conditioner didn't work very well and ended up breaking in the middle of our first night there. When we contacted the front desk we were immediately moved to another room which ended up being much nicer. I don't think the hotel had any food options, but there are plenty of restaurants in the surrounding area. It will take a cab ride to get to the Beale Street area.

Reviews.Title: “Sleazy”
Reviews.Author: angel123Newton_texas
Reviews.Content: Facility barely decent to stay at, lobby full of nude female art not good for children, no food available at all in facility, no coffee available anywhere in facility, one soda machine, refridgerator in room did not work at all, never replaced by staff, never extra linen or towels, rooms could be cleaner, carpet very stained, staff stated that they had asked for coffee at least and have not gotten even a machine for them they must bring there own from home, parking is a huge problem very small parking lot and underground parking impossible for SUV's roof too low to park, I stayed in facility for 4 nights and was not happy at all, elevators very slow, lobby very dark and air conditioning poor in lobby and elevators, room air was good

Reviews.Title: “Pride 07”
Reviews.Author: Worldwide22
Reviews.Content: I though that this was the most horrible hotel ive ever stayed in the only thing that i liked about it was the decor other than that id rather stay in my car rather than to stay in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad First experience”
Reviews.Author: bgold
Reviews.Content: I booked the Artisan Hotel because it was the closest Hotel from my conference at the Peabody and was 3 miles away for the best price. The logistics of getting back and forth was a hassle and cabs are expensive so i took the bus. When I checked in the first night my card for my door did not work 2 times. When i finally got in the toilet didn't work. Not a ggod start. It was fixed the next day and I really liked that they had a desktop computer to work for free since I didn't bring my laptop and had work to do. Everthing else was fine with my visit except for when I left my room for 45 min. came back and my room was cleaned and i left my wallet by the TV instead of on my body or hiding it and a $10 bill was gone. I could not prove it and at the front desk it says they are not held liable for lost or stolen items, so I did not bring it up. When i came back i emailed the corporate office and a Mr. Barrera emailed me back apologizing for the situation and refunded $10 back to me and offered another one night stay which was very generous of him. I would give it another chance, I will just keep my wallet with me this time.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Artisan Hotel in Memphis, TN.”
Reviews.Author: 2witchers
Reviews.Content: That was the worst hotel experience we've ever had. First of all, we had to change rooms 4 (FOUR) times....four times. The first room was never cleaned -- they made up the bed (never changed the sheets), bathroom filthy, room smelled like mold. The second room -- bathroom sink was busted. The third room -- good, but they gave us separate beds. We's married folk. Fourth room -- King sized bed. Finally. 1 of the 2 elevators are working. Dining area...still closed. Hotel staff...clueless. Must been staff in training. Hotel smells terrible. We were there 5 days and 5 nights and the last day they decided to spray a deodorizer in the hallway...Now that's ghetto. Don't believe the pictures they show on the website, because the one in Memphis was totally the opposite. DON'T STAY HERE!!!! P.S. The only good things were the price and the location.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: baxter1966
Reviews.Content: Where do I start....NO coffee maker in room, NO restraunt, NO bar, NO breakfast, NO cont. Breakfast....The staff was pretty rude. The man who checked us in was on the phone with a person he was giving directions to the hotel. He hung up on them... I could still hear the person talking as he hung the phone up. The lobby was really pretty but carpets throughout the hotel were worn and need a good cleaning. We had to pay for parking which was really no big deal but they neglected to tell us that little bit of info until we were checking out and it was like "oh by the way, you have to pay for parking". And the parking was pretty scary too. 3 levels of UNDERGROUND parking and did not see one security guard there. Another thing that really bothered us is that we had our neices with us and the sliding glass window opened and there were no bars or a balcony. It wouldn't have bothered us but one of our neices is 8 years old and you know their curiosity can get the best of them and being on the 7th floor at that. Nothing between you and the concrete below. Mind you it is an old and restored building but the noise of others was pretty loud, just while you were walking down the hallways. It wasn't that bad in the rooms. Live and Learn

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC, AND EMBARRASSED!!! 5-19-2007”
Reviews.Author: jo8242005
Reviews.Content: NEVER!! If you are on this website, please go to another one. This hotel is horrible. Nothing like the pictures. We brought in friends from Minnesota to enjoy the nice BBQ in Memphis. Not only was I not disappointed in the hotel, I was embarrassed! Lets begin: 1. only one elevator worked in the whole hotel. Making the elevator ride and wait aprox. 20 mins long. Each time. Quicker to take the stairs. 2. The bar was closed, except for the party that they were having, but you had to be a member of the party to be included. 3. Resturant was closed, no contenital breakfast here!!! 4. Bathrooms in the rooms were NASTY!!! No ammentities, that is for sure. 5. The rooms look nothing like the pictures on the website. Can we say Motel 6? That probably would have been a better stay. 6. My friends stayed in a suite, 179.99. The bed was propped up on Telephone books. It was also sinking in the middle. 7. Carpets were nasty 8. Pool area was filthy. 9. No taxi service. They has a "person" that helps them out. SCARY!!! 10. This hotel should only cost $20.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: mrstarStLoius
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible, beginning with the front desk manager Maryann, who made us pay a 50.00 deposit on our rooms even if paid with cash, if you paid by credit she charged your card and did not tell you, so if you happen to stay there please check your card. She also tried not to refund my deposit stating she forgot. The elevator did not work we got stuck in between floors and had to jump out, it was also the only half-way working elevator in the building. The owner Mr. B.was just as bad as Maryann, the attitude sucks, they said we could leave but was not willing to give us a refund. The sink was stopped up the entire time. We ask to see the elevator certification which happens to be public information they said no. I booked my rooms back in January and they did not want to put us on the same floor which I had requested,I had ten rooms so we spent a lot of money. Some rooms smell like roach spray, so we kept switching rooms and the keys don't open half of the doors. The owner, Mr B. threatened to tow our van because he needed the spot for spotlights, and we paid 6.50 for parking and was instructed to park there by Ms. Dixon, because there is no parking for large vans in their garage he(Mr.B) told, us to park on the street are on walgreens lot without permission he was very racial, Mr.B. will be reported to memphis attorney general. Please don't stay there, this is the hotel from hell. Don't look at the photos, they are very deceiving, the lobby and, lobby restrooms are true and thats its.

Reviews.Title: “Was only hotel available for Memphis in May”
Reviews.Author: theridehome
Reviews.Content: We were going to the Beale Street Music Fest, and though we booked the hotel a month in advance, the Artisan was still the only hotel within 3 miles that had openings. It was only $90/night, so it really wasn't too bad, but our room was on the top floor and they obviously hadn't renovated it yet. Room was kind of dingy, but I expected that for an old hotel. Just when I was thinking it wasn't so bad, I got in the bed and found DIRT AND BROKEN GLASS. Ok, it was a small piece of broken glass and could have been from someone's earring, but still. It was freaky. The bathroom was small and kind of moldy, and the shower was VERY small (there's a bar in there that you'll hit your arm on when you try to wash your hair, even if you are very thin like I am.) Also, try to take a shower when no one else on your floor is, becase there is almost NO water pressure at peak times. And the water temp. was always hard to control. It took about 10 minutes to get warm, and then became scalding hot. By the end of my 15 minute shower (it took that long for the lack of water pressure) I had the faucet turned all the way to cold and I was still feeling burned by the water. For the price and the fact that it was the only place left within cab-ride distance to Beale Street it wasn't too bad, I guess, but I will not stay here again. Note: if you are looking to stay here for the festival, remember you will pay $10-$15 in cab fare ONE WAY to Beale Street. And to get back at night it can cost $25-$30, if you can even find a cabbie that will go that far (yeah, apparently 3 miles is too far for cabbies off Beale St.). So if you can find a hotel closer that costs about $50 more, it's worth it. But if you do end up at the Artisan, try to ask if you can stay in one of their renovated rooms. I didn't see them, but they can't be any worse than the old nasty one I stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: Tiberious555
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for location and supposed ammenities such as a lounge and restaurant. The lounge was gutted and the restaurant was never open during our trip. They tried to get us to pay for parking even though my itinerary shows free parking and continental breakfast....which they dont have. I do not recomment this hotel unless you have a car to get around as it in the middle of nowhere and very few places to eat. You have to walk across a busy street to get a morning coffee as there is not a maker in the room or in the lobby area. We will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Taiwan_Girl
Reviews.Content: Even though our air conditioner didn't work well and the restaurant downstairs wasn't open, I give this hotel an above average rating because I had a very pleasant stay there. The staff were helpful and kind, and the lobby is attractive and comfortable enough to hang out in, in the evening. They had wireless internet. The hotel is a three-mile straight shot to downtown Memphis. They have an underground parking garage priced at $6.50 a night, and the price we got for our room was only $55, yet the room and the hallways were just nicer and had a little more character than the cheap motels you usually get for that price. They have a small outdoor swimming pool too! And the building has details that I appreciate--gilded mirrors in the elevator, for example. (Okay, only one of the elevators was working, but stairs are better for you anyway!) They have no in-room coffee makers, which would ordinarily send me right into withdrawal--but with a Starbucks a half a block away, that's not such an inconvenience. There's also a Walgreen's across the street, and within a short drive of the hotel is Overton Park, with a zoo and art museum and flowers and trees that were gorgeous in April. I also liked the fact that our hotel seemed to reflect the 50/50 racial balance of the city. As you can tell, I liked this hotel. I recommend it and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent...Remote Area”
Reviews.Author: robinson62
Reviews.Content: It's my first day here and so far so good. I basically just needed a place to lay my head. It was easy to get downtown on the bus (#56) but it took awhile for it to come (something I'm finding common with southern bus systems). The lobby is cute, the room is boring looking and there were a few things I photographed that weren't on point (i.e. tile missing on bathroom floor, only one washcloth etc.). It was 'hella cold' in the hallway but I blasted the heat as soon as I hit my room. I would rather have stayed at a hotel on Main as I did before but this is ok at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamig
Reviews.Content: The first room they put me in had mold in the shower, a dirty toilet bowl and water damage on the ceiling. I was put in a new room which, although it was clean, still had a bulb missing in a light fixture and no blow drier. The bed also was horrible and the floor, if it was clean, probably would have been more comfortable. They also charge for parking and when I told them I would rather park in the street than in their dark, unsafe garage, they still wanted to charge me. There are much nicer other places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly”
Reviews.Author: demonfly724
Reviews.Content: Worse Hotel in the World the Rooms do not look like any of the Pics at all . The Restaurant is all you can Buffet which who the hell wants a Buffet every day. There Bar is not even up and going like it says on the site, and it wont be up till this summer. the Parking is kind of scary you have to park under the hotel where there hardly any light. I felt like i was staying at motel 6 which looks better inside and out compared to this place. ill never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Like The Website”
Reviews.Author: MARCHETA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked The Artisan Hotel after finding it online. The website showed it to be a 4-Star, upscale place with lush accomodations and services. When we got there it looked like a Motel 6. I have nothing against a Motel 6 if that is what I'm booking and paying for. When I asked why the rooms were different, the manager seemed to be annoyed and told me that the rooms on the website were showrooms that had been renovated. Had they only had a few of these, it would have been nice to know that I would not be in one, or even that there were a chance that I would not get one. The way it was done, I did not know that enything else was a possibility other than what was shown online. Besides the disappointing room, the bathroom was dirty, we didn't get towels or cups until we asked for them. Then, we had to wait so long on the towels, we didn't have time to shower before our dinner reservations. MY FINAL THOUGHT: STAY AWAY FROM THE ARTISAN HOTEL IN MEMPHIS, TENNESSEE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Completely Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: traveluu
Reviews.Content: I wanted to post a review after being slightly scared off by some of the other reviews. I called before staying to find out what the rooms included (shampoo, ironing boards, etc.). I was told that they are the equivalent to a Hampton Inn. After staying here, I'd say that's about right. The room was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. They let us check in at 10am, which was very nice as our flight arrived at 9am. They let us switch rooms because the room at the end of the hall didn't have a very strong connection to the wireless internet. They have wireless router on every floor, near the elevator. We ended up getting a room right next to the elevator and the wireless was perfect. (Their first suggestion to us was to just come down to the lobby every time we needed to use the internet, we told them that was not a good solution for us). I wouldn't recommend counting on the wake up call. Ours was 1 1/2 hours late. Other strangeness...a room that we could see from the outside had a broken window (as if a TV had been thrown through it). And we arrived back at the hotel around midnight one night and a man who looked like he had just been punched in the face and was bleeding from the eye got off the elevator. We didn't try the restaurant, but it was open for business and seemed to have a nice menu for breakfast and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've EVER stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ARTISANhotelSUX
Reviews.Content: Do Not Even Think About Staying In This Nasty, Horrible, Hell-Spawning Pit! We Had The Awful Misfortune Of Renting Two Rooms -For Which They Charged 3 Star Rates!!!!- And There Was No Water In Either Room....No Water To Use The Toilet, Bathe, Brush Your Teeth. These People Should Be Put Out Of Business. We Thought It Would Be No Problem To Not Pay Because There Was No Water But, Our Credit Card Company Said If You Sign The Check In Voucher, You Have Accepted The Room As Is....Beware. Worst Hotel Experience In Our Lives (And We Were With The In-Laws!)

Reviews.Title: “We had Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Linda71
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, check in was very pleasant. The room we were given had been freshly painted and therefore had an extremly strong paint smell. We asked to be moved and we were moved to another room. That night after we had bathed we realized that once we walked around on the floor barefoot, that the bottom of our feet were black. The floors were not clean. On the 2nd night my husband woke up at midnight to find the bathroom counter full of roaches. We asked to see the manager and was told that he would not be in until later but that he would call us, which he never did. Upon check out, we asked again to see the manager and was told he was not in but we could leave our numbers and he would call us. It is now 2 days later and he still has not called. Upon giving the room a double check to make sure we had not left any belongings - we have a 2 year old so we were checking under beds for toys - we found the "roach motels" that you can purchase at any store. The hotel knew that the room had roaches in it when they placed us in that room. Imagine how you would feel if your 2 year old child had been playing where roaches had been and where the floors turned her feet black.

Reviews.Title: “Go To The Artisan Hotel In Memphis TN, It Is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lady4u677
Reviews.Content: The Artisan Hotel in Memphis TN is a nice soothing and relaxing place. We visited Memphis TN by way of VA During the American Idol Weekend. The Artisan was the best stay ever. They available rooms and made us feel special as guest and good rates. In my book that means a lot. So visit the Artisan Hotel, enjoy the lounge, pool and good food. 1837 Union Avenue Memphis TN. 38104 901 278 4100

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: oct81
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for two nights at the Artisan Hotel as it was cheap, and in a convient area of town. The lobby is beautiful (totally misleading). Our room had cold water with no water pressure. Other guests had no water at all. When complaints were made to hotel staff they acted as though there was no problem. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: kansastraveler1
Reviews.Content: We thought we were getting a good deal when we booked a room at this hotel (Room 522) and my friends' (Room 520). My friend booked us those two rooms for 90.00 each per night. Then my other friends (there were a group of us in town for a function) were able to book a room for 59.00 each. Which may be the way the cookie crumbles when booking and bargaining on [--------------] so that is not my real complaint. So we still thought things were good when we checked in, the people looked professionally dressed, but then guy on duty mumbled everything when explaining the check in process and I had to ask repeatedly for him to repeat himself. Now, looking back I think he was hiding things in those garbled words. Still, the lobby looked pretty neat with those "kitchy' decorations etc. and I seemed to have no reason to be wary. But once we were given our room key after being forced to sign some documents to check in, things took a turn for the worse, we parked in thier underground lot and had to search for the elevator (which the signs still said Ramada) which upon entering the elevator was found to be dirty, the we arrived at our floor, and walked down the dirty hall to our even filthier rooms. Just a sample: The shower curtain had a disgusting brownish goo all over it, the toilet seat was broken and dirty, the carpet was dirty, there was nothing comlimentary, except one bar of soap, no shampoo nothing else, then my friend found a little rolled up ball of steel mesh on the floor, which he said he had seen on a news show that people use that to smoke crack, then the cabinet holding the sink up in the bathroom had a piece the size of a basketball broken out of it, and I am glad that we didn't have any kids with us because the windows opened all the way (a good four and a half foot wide- I have never been in a hotel that didn't have safety devices to keep you from accidentaly falling out). But the worst experience of all was when we went to check out, they charged us an extra $100.00 because they said we were smoking cigarrettes in the room, which was not the truth, and then they said there was nothing we could do about it. When we protested and mentioned that the room was not clean or vacuumed and the shower curtain was nasty and the broken bits and any traces of cigarrette would have been from previous tenants as the place was not cleaned, the manager on duty said that they were undergoing a change of ownership and that those things - like the shower curtain -just needed to be replaced and I asked well, then why would you rent out a room like that? I think that they are using these extra charges to remodel the place (if they are remodling at all). I am trying at the moment to file a complaint with the Tennessee division of consumer protection but cannot remember the manager's name (no name tags) whom I spoke with and cannot find the number for the hotel online as we booked it with [---------]and the Artisan conveniently is not in the yellow pages and I think that they book all thier rooms this way so that one cannot call them later to complain and perhaps know that a person wishing to file a complaint with the state must provide information such as the telephone number and that works to thier advantage. Rent a room here if you wish, I just want to do my part to warn people about this place. Our experience ruined our entire trip. Don't say you weren't warned. Oh, and how could I forget, one of my friends staying at the Artisan the same weekend, got his mp3 player stolen whilst it was left in the room, when he complained the hotel said they were not responsible for lost or stolen articles. They don't seem to be very responsible indeed.

Reviews.Title: “cute place”
Reviews.Author: dslim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the beaten path but it has it upsides. First you are across the street from a starbucks and a Walgreens. You also are less than 5 minutes from downtown by cab and the cost is about 8 bucks. The cost to the arirport is 25 bucks. The hotel is is a wonderful neighborhood and you should get out and walk around while you are there. The rooms are not the greatest and they do look dated but i did not spend too much time in my room so I really did not care. Most local attractions are close to get to and the staff always called the car service for me - try to stick with the same driver while you are there. I also went to several local eateries in the neighborhood one was hueys and the othr is neils. they oth are a short walk to mc clean and madison - great people cheap and good southern food. If you want to end your vacation with some money in your pocket and still be close to the attractions then i recommend the Artisan. But if want to be downtown and pay doublebe at and come home with less cash then this is not the place for you.On my next trip to Memphis I will be at the Artisan. They also have underground parking for free and a restaurant on site.

HotelInfo.Name: Artisan Hotel Memphis
HotelInfo.Address: 1837 Union Ave, Memphis, TN 38103
